snippet.textDisplay: As a fellow dad, I feel you. I really appreciate you sharing your feelings with the world. Takes some bravery to do so, especially on such a scale, but people need to hear this kind of thing, that others have experienced similar hardships, self-doubt, and uncertainty about what really matters in life. For what it's worth, I think you are doing the right thing. When thinking about life & death, sometimes we can only hope that the time we have here is well spent, cuz hey, it might be the only time we have. I've always found your work to be both useful AND entertaining, which is pretty great as far as I'm concerned.
snippet.textOriginal: As a fellow dad, I feel you. I really appreciate you sharing your feelings with the world. Takes some bravery to do so, especially on such a scale, but people need to hear this kind of thing, that others have experienced similar hardships, self-doubt, and uncertainty about what really matters in life. For what it's worth, I think you are doing the right thing. When thinking about life & death, sometimes we can only hope that the time we have here is well spent, cuz hey, it might be the only time we have. I've always found your work to be both useful AND entertaining, which is pretty great as far as I'm concerned.

snippet.textDisplay:
Wow man.. My heart goes out to you and your family. Thank you for this. To sit here and break down and let us into your life and mind like this. Thank you.

You made me rethink every part of myself.

I need to say something small to you. YOU made a difference to that kid. YOU make a difference to us ALL. You are right. He had Leukemia.. there’s nothing we all know to do to fix that. But you can make him forget. Make him forget about the impending doom. Just keep being you man.

I’m not here to dictate your life, or “pick you up off the mat” lol but you help me. You deserve to know, past all the bullshit in this world, I can SEE your passion. You LOVE what you do. YOU make us all forget the dumb stuff around in our lives. Do what you can, and this is what you can!! You deserve to live. All I can say is just remember your family, and you are apart of that. If you need to stop, because YOU do, then make yourself happy! We will ALWAYS be here to support you!! I truly enjoy watching your videos I can’t change my finances right now so damnit I enjoy watching you build a shitty computer from Wish because someone has to know!? Thanks again my friend! Thank you for this, truly
snippet.textOriginal:
Wow man.. My heart goes out to you and your family. Thank you for this. To sit here and break down and let us into your life and mind like this. Thank you. 

You made me rethink every part of myself. 

I need to say something small to you. YOU made a difference to that kid. YOU make a difference to us ALL. You are right. He had Leukemia.. there’s nothing we all know to do to fix that. But you can make him forget. Make him forget about the impending doom. Just keep being you man. 

I’m not here to dictate your life, or “pick you up off the mat” lol but you help me. You deserve to know, past all the bullshit in this world, I can SEE your passion. You LOVE what you do. YOU make us all forget the dumb stuff around in our lives. Do what you can, and this is what you can!! You deserve to live. All I can say is just remember your family, and you are apart of that. If you need to stop, because YOU do, then make yourself happy! We will ALWAYS be here to support you!! I truly enjoy watching your videos I can’t change my finances right now so damnit I enjoy watching you build a shitty computer from Wish because someone has to know!? Thanks again my friend! Thank you for this, truly

snippet.textDisplay:
Hey Linus,

I absolutely love your videos, and as a fellow tech enthusiast (and self-proclaimed geek) you have helped ground me over the years and give me a community of like minded people that make me feel like home.

You're a good dude and I appreciate your heartfelt words in this video.

I wish the best for you and your family.

Also, I'm sorry for the comment the other day during the livestream.

And yes, we would be sad. <3
snippet.textOriginal:
Hey Linus, 

I absolutely love your videos, and as a fellow tech enthusiast (and self-proclaimed geek) you have helped ground me over the years and give me a community of like minded people that make me feel like home.

You're a good dude and I appreciate your heartfelt words in this video.

I wish the best for you and your family.

Also, I'm sorry for the comment the other day during the livestream.

And yes, we would be sad.  <3

snippet.textDisplay: You are living proof that a computer geek (like myself) can make a living doing what they love (contrary to what absolutely everyone told me when I was growing up). I ended up going a different route because of naysayers, and I find your story inspiring and uplifting. Whatever you decide to do, I think the world is better for having you in it, be it teaching, inspiring or just helping people wrap their brains around the things that fill our daily lives. And I think that's as much as any of us can hope for.
snippet.textOriginal: You are living proof that a computer geek (like myself) can make a living doing what they love (contrary to what absolutely everyone told me when I was growing up). And I think that's as much as any of us can hope for.

snippet.textDisplay:
Out of respect for all you've done and accomplished, your choices, whatever they may be, are supported.
But, and this is a big one. Coming from Dororo/DHawk/Talon directly whatever name you recognize(went through way too many over the years).
Please wait until at least end of March to actually retire. Need time to get stuff together to give you as big of a send off as possible as you deserve for all you've done.

Your work has meant a lot to a lot of people, and helped many, and while I respect when you feel it's time, I'd be disappointed in myself if I didn't give you as big of congratulations/final send off as I could with whatever reach I have left anywhere.

You deserve it. So please hold as I beg areas for any last remaining favors I can across the tech board to give you that one appropriate big retirement gift I can.
I owe you that. For all you've done.

Thank you for all you've done.

snippet.textDisplay: Although a major milestone for you, your team  and your company. In the grand scheme of things it will make little difference in the way that people behave. Ten Million Subs is huge for Linus Media Group and you and yours, the world will not skip a beat if it were not here. So you do you and let everyone else do them. Feeling the way you do right now is a blend of many things, including guilt for your success (in the sense that so many others have very little). time away from your loved ones and  more. Never let the weight of the world settle on your shoulders, it's too much. I'm glad that there is a decent human behind the chilling and promotional gimmicks. What I'm trying to say is take of your family and your life and ALWAYS follow your heart.
snippet.textOriginal: Although a major milestone for you, your team  and your company. In the grand scheme of things it will make little difference in the way that people behave. Ten Million Subs is huge for Linus Media Group and you and yours, the world will not skip a beat if it were not here. So you do you and let everyone else do them. Feeling the way you do right now is a blend of many things, including guilt for your success (in the sense that so many others have very little). time away from your loved ones and  more. Never let the weight of the world settle on your shoulders, it's too much. I'm glad that there is a decent human behind the chilling and promotional gimmicks. What I'm trying to say is take of your family and your life and ALWAYS follow your heart.

snippet.textDisplay:
Don't know if this will get read but I've been a longtime subscriber of LTT. I broke my first computer when I was 15 and put it back together. Since then I've loved tech and when I came across this channel I was hooked. I got into IT because I'm good at fixing problems and I like helping others. That's pretty much why I do what I do. I love tech and I love helping others and fixing problems. And this channel definitely helped.

So yeah, I'm also weird. Socially awkward, don't have a lot of friends, love science fiction/fantasy, love video games, love messing with computers and tech. I also get excited when I get my hands on something new or if I can break something to see what it can do. Cause why the hell not??

Anyways, thanks Linus. You're the man now dog.
snippet.textOriginal:
Don't know if this will get read but I've been a longtime subscriber of LTT. I broke my first computer when I was 15 and put it back together. I love tech and I love helping others and fixing problems. And this channel definitely helped. 

So yeah, I'm also weird. Socially awkward, don't have a lot of friends, love science fiction/fantasy, love video games, love messing with computers and tech. I also get excited when I get my hands on something new or if I can break something to see what it can do. Cause why the hell not??

Anyways, thanks Linus. You're the man now dog.

snippet.textDisplay: Just wanted to say, that Linus Tech Tips channel is the thing that got me hooked into Youtube. I think this was the first channel, I subscribed to and actually waited for the next video always. Your ability to bring such great content that most tech youtubers do not have is just amazing privilege. I love watching you build your mad network and making crazy builds, that most people can't afford or have tools for. Do what you love, but I really hope you keep bringing this content, that can't be found anywhere else.

snippet.textDisplay: #37 ON TRENDING, now!
snippet.textOriginal: #37 ON TRENDING, now!

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm so incredibly glad to have you in my life. I know we don't know each other. But your digital presence has had tremendous inspiration on my own life. Lifted me on dreary days.

Do your own thing, just know your valued for much more than you give yourself credit for. The purpose of life is to swim through misery to reach those moments of pure bliss.

People come and go, and that makes those memories so much sweeter. For all its flaws, this life is worth living. The end will come for all of us.

Some may say what's the point? The point is to live, enjoy what you have, love and lose, work to leave the world a better place, because tomorrow is never promised.
snippet.textOriginal:

People come and go, and that makes those memories so much sweeter. For all its flaws, this life is worth living. The end will come for all of us. 

Some may say what's the point? The point is to live, enjoy what you have, love and lose, work to leave the world a better place, because tomorrow is never promised.

snippet.textDisplay:
You know what, Linus, to do what you love is one of the most rewarding thing in the world, doing it for helping other is even more, because even if you think is not enough or is not a big deal, it is for the other guy, that's the point. To know that what you do, say or think is valuable for someone else, makes you think and realize you are not alone in this world, that what you do matters, that what you do change lifes even if we are not aware of that.

My advice? Be you, always, do what you love, always, with all your heart because every act may be the one act that will change the life of someone, even yours.

Cheers man, cheers to the team and keep doing what makes you happy.

snippet.textDisplay: Hang in there. Step back some and spend more time with the family. They are the most important thing. Looking forward to seeing the "NEW" Linus in the future who is healthy and happy with what he is doing in life. Don't fall into the trap of feeling like you have to do everything. That's why you created LMG. Stay involved and get that Tech-Fix we all know and love. Then be able to step back when you need to and watch the beauty of both your family and the company which you created that make your life what it is. Don't ever stop being the NERD we have come to love watching your videos.

snippet.textDisplay:
I am having a hard time myself recently. Really hard time, loss of family members, love, work. All that. But what do I do to keep my level of joy on a level way above a depression is watching channels like yours. You help a different way. I studied for 9 years to improve plant growth, produce medicine, feed the world and stuff. Now I ended up in a diagnostic lab checking sugar beet for diseases that the farmer gave us. It feels like a huge step down. But I know that even this way I can help, and I can still "upgrade".


To you: Take off some responsibility, let some other guys from your team host some videos. They do great aswell, Anthony is one funny chunkball. Do a video once a week only, let the others do the other days. You can still do stuff that feels more meaningful to you (your work is meaningful to 10 million people, thats more than 99% of the politians worldwide), but raising kids and teaching them your point of view is like the most meaningful thing you can do. In 100 years your views will be carried by thousands of people. And they get to see fun videos when the PC wasnt the size of an acron and transplanted into us or whatever.

I think this video is wonderful and filled with gratuity, yes you can retire, you've helped a ton of people with tech, from picking the right one to building their first computer (me included), but yea retire if you want to, be a family man, or leave the youtube community if you want and live a private life.

snippet.textDisplay:
You're right. None of what you do really matters on a grander scale.
You aren't Musk or Bezos.
Even then, make the scale grander and they do nothing.

So make the scale smaller. Realize the small things you do and people you affect does have value.
To those that are inspired by you, care for you, or even just are entertained by you, you are important. No they aren't the world. But they are people you affect, the ones you form a bond with.
I'm sure you'd rather know a few you care for than a world of strangers. Same applies to what you do to affect this world. Enrich the lives of those around you rather than trying to fix a world of strangers.

Anyway, thanks for all the content. You're why I ended up liking tech so much.

Anyway, thanks for all the content. You're why I ended up liking tech so much.

snippet.textDisplay:
Hey,
I'm watching your videos for a very long time now and I don't remember one I thought it was a bad video. I hope you do what you think what's right because that's hopefully the thing you feel best with.

If you often ask yourself about having an impact, you maybe could do some contet about technologies for saving the environment or at least try it (e.g. Fairphone, shift phone) or maybe something about great projects. Alternatively you could try to generate your own impact for example by design or sell special products with the smallest possible C02 footprint (or try to reduce the environmental footprint).
That would be maybe not the content everybody is interested but it would be an opportunity I think.

Finally I hope for new crazy tech videos and wish you the best
snippet.textOriginal:
Hey,
I'm watching your videos for a very long time now and I don't remember one I thought it was a bad video. I hope you do what you think what's right because that's hopefully the thing you feel best with.

If you often ask yourself about having an impact, you maybe could do some contet about technologies for saving the environment or at least try it (e.g. Fairphone, shift phone) or maybe something about great projects. Alternatively you could try to generate your own impact for example by design or sell special products with the smallest possible C02 footprint (or  try to reduce the environmental footprint).
That would be maybe not the content everybody is interested but it would be an opportunity I think.

Finally I hope for new crazy tech videos and wish you the best

snippet.textDisplay: Ultimately, we are still mutated apes flying through empty space on a huge rock filled with water. Unfortunately for our personal happiness, we have developed consciousness, so we happen to question our existence. I wouldn't even go down that route. Just fill your life with what makes you happy because I don't think there is a satisfying answer to "deeper" questions. You're gonna die, I'm gonna die, everybody is gonna die. Doesn't matter. Being dead is never a threat to you. Either, you're alive and worrying about being dead one day just makes you unhappy and takes away from your life. Or, you're dead, in which case nothing matters at all any more. Just enjoy life as well as you can. Keep the bigger picture in mind.
snippet.textOriginal: Ultimately, we are still mutated apes flying through empty space on a huge rock filled with water. Being dead is never a threat to you. Either, you're alive and worrying about being dead one day just makes you unhappy and takes away from your life. Or, you're dead, in which case nothing matters at all any more. Just enjoy life as well as you can. Keep the bigger picture in mind.

snippet.textDisplay:
I've related to a lot you had to say. It's hard to deal with all this stuff. You've done a lot and it may or may not matter in the end, but if it's possible to have an impact, you've done it. Enjoy your life and take breaks if you need to. I feel your hate of waste and I'm really happy and weirdly proud (even though I've never met you) of you are/have become.


We all love your videos, but your real fans will understand what you're doing/feeling. Just live your life and come see us in some videos once in a while if you feel up to it!

We all love your videos, but your real fans will understand what you're doing/feeling. Just live your life and come see us in some videos once in a while if you feel up to it!

snippet.textDisplay: @Linus If you retire now, you are going to get old at a young age, get bored, ugly and die young. Don't you dare. Don't set anymore targets like for yourself. Don't let your You Tube channel run your life. Take a bake, relax and come back again when you are ready. Treat You Tubing more as a hobby. Concentrate more on your business instead.  Never give up. Never stop moving. Just take it easy. There are 10 million people out there that love you.
snippet.textOriginal: @Linus If you retire now, you are going to get old at a young age, get bored, ugly and die young. Don't you dare. Don't set anymore targets like for yourself. Don't let your You Tube channel run your life. Take a bake, relax and come back again when you are ready. Treat You Tubing more as a hobby. Concentrate more on your business instead.  Never give up. Never stop moving. Just take it easy. There are 10 million people out there that love you.

snippet.textDisplay:
Even if you never saw or spoke to your subscribers I want to assure you most of us (the 10.000.000 "us") consider you as a really good friend or even almost like a family member. You helped and taught many viewers, you inspired them and you made them laugh (many times). We will support you!

You have a very good team, so take a break! A long one! Spend more time with the ones you love, go visit new places, do things you always wanted to do but couldn't because of the time you spent working for this channel.

Just enjoy life and your family and we will be happy for you!

p.s.: If you ever decide to travel come to Portugal you must try a dish called Francesinha (Northern region of Portugal.

snippet.textDisplay: I found you a month ago when I was researching how to build a PC. Loved (still do) your channel and was stoked for this new PC journey. Successfully built my PC last month. I'm enjoying your videos but it sucks to hear you are thinking of retiring. But seeing the list of videos you have made throughout the years, I can tell you deserve your break. Whatever makes you happy, just live your life. Thank you for the help that I was able to gather when building my first PC.
